UnitType.Backstory: I was bound to a channeler long ago. She was murdered, and yet I did not fade away. For a long time I have wandered, and I believe I can now serve you.

UnitType.Description:
A Sion-like Warrior who gains traits with each level, but cannot cast spells and dies permanently.
Some would say the Quendar are too sadistic and evil to ever cooperate with the kingdoms. But honor is the highest virtue to the Quendar, and in some circumstances the upholding of honor means turning away from heritage. A leader that rewards loyalty and honor will command these great warriors who have been spurned by their kin.

Exemplars are promising young men who have survived the Trog transformation into Juggernauts - but then mastered rage to become Exemplars. Incredibly strong and gifted in magic, they level like champions (but do not split xp).
UnitType.Backstory: Only the greatest young men of the highest integrity and character are approached to become Exemplars. The process is almost identical to that of creating the Trog Juggernauts - but instead of creating a frenzied killing killing machine and then releasing them to fight, an Exemplar must then control his rage. What remains is a monster who has mastered his deepest rage with meditation and dedication. The Exemplar is a ultimate defender of civilization, immune to aging, attuned to arcana, and will turn even on Senators or Generals if they betray Carian's people.

UnitType.Description: Exemplars are promising young men who have survived the Trog transformation into Juggernauts - but then mastered rage to become Exemplars. Incredibly strong and gifted in magic, they level like champions (but do not split xp).

The process is almost identical to that of creating the Trog Juggernauts - but instead of creating a frenzied killing killing machine and then releasing them to fight, an Exemplar must then control his rage. What remains is a monster who has mastered his deepest rage with meditation and dedication. The Exemplar is a ultimate defender of civilization, immune to aging, attuned to arcana, and will turn even on Senators or Generals if they betray Carian's people.

The Exemplar is a ultimate defender of civilization, immune to aging, attuned to arcana, and will turn even on Senators or Generals if they betray Carian's people.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: Nobility is in action. And the magic in these veins shall serve any country that upholds nobility and honor.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: We Krax know survival. I have been cast out, but if you take me in I will prove the strength of my people. Even if I must fight my old brothers and sisters themselves, our opponents shall know my strength.
I am a poor armorer. But I am hearty, and will lend you a stout arm to defeat your foes.

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
UnitType.Backstory: I am no trader. I care little for money or trade, but your society seems to have a purpose I can follow.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: What was Curgen's imperative to his sons, if not honor? The Titans are gone, and it is time to serve a strong master once more. The Quendar prize honor and strength, but does not honor persist beyond battles and years? Do not those who prove a new strength, deserve honorable servants? I shall serve the country that promises to endure.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: I do not care who I fight. So long as I do so with friends, I shall fight back the Dred'nir themselves!

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: Ha! What does it matter, the side one fights on? Does it matter, who is slain, Fallen or Man-ling? It does not. What matters is that the mighty strived and bled. Let it be known D'rogs strode for this country! Let its opponents tremble, for D'rogs fight for it!
I had great missions in life. In this next form, my ambitions have not entirely dissipated.

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
UnitType.Backstory: My kind are rarely pensive. But I have many ideas, and know I am called to greatness. Give me a chance to prove my potential.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: We are all bound to Ceresa, by magic. But at distance, the bond weakens. I know my destiny is not as a Wraith servant, but for something more.
